main event: A civilian pilot nearly collide with a high-tailed aircraft while flying his Cessna near Marion, Ohio on September 16, 1951.
interesting points: The object had a 45-degree slantback wing and was moving straight north at a high speed., The incident was reported by a Captain and then forwarded to the District Office., The sighting occurred at an altitude of 2300 feet., The pilot reported maintaining a constant course towards the northeast., After the incident, it was concluded that the sighting was possibly a conventional aircraft.
sighted object: a high-tailed aircraft with a slantback wing
witness description: a civilian pilot flying a Cessna aircraft
